text:
Here is my 2-minute week for last week. I seem to get these out on Tuesdays after recording on Sunday/Monday. This week: compiler does index offset counting for stack variables, hello world printed to "terminal device", started some stdlib like functions, animated an image in emulated hardware.
<https://youtu.be/KvJ8I4jnXEE>

attachments.title: 2 Minute Week #2
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KvJ8I4jnXEE?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

elements.text: Here is my 2-minute week for last week. I seem to get these out on Tuesdays after recording on Sunday/Monday. This week: compiler does index offset counting for stack variables, hello world printed to "terminal device", started some stdlib like functions, animated an image in emulated hardware.

text: I also managed, somehow to get most of the details of how MicroCISC works into a single video on YouTube. It is 36 minutes but covers the indexing modes, instruction syntax, memory banking and walks through the hello world and Everest code in much more detail. <https://youtu.be/Hj8gz2ZeNb0>

attachments.title: It Works! Introducing Homebrew Assembly Language!
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: It Works! Introducing Homebrew Assembly Language!
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hj8gz2ZeNb0?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

elements.text: I also managed, somehow to get most of the details of how MicroCISC works into a single video on YouTube. It is 36 minutes but covers the indexing modes, instruction syntax, memory banking and walks through the hello world and Everest code in much more detail.

text:
I've been watching your MicroCISC intro video. Great stuff. :heart:

I hate to be that guy, but I have one big meta critique. The audio levels are a bit all over the place. Some parts are much louder than others, and the audio as whole is very low for me.  (ironically, the videos of you standing next to the white board further from your computer seem better.)

I bring this up because the editing and content are quite good and polished in comparison!

elements.text: I've been watching your MicroCISC intro video. Great stuff.

I hate to be that guy, but I have one big meta critique. The audio levels are a bit all over the place. Some parts are much louder than others, and the audio as whole is very low for me.  (ironically, the videos of you standing next to the white board further from your computer seem better.)

I bring this up because the editing and content are quite good and polished in comparison!

text: Yeah... I had MAJOR microphone malfunctions on this one. I was very disappointed when I got it all recorded and realized it had been going through the iPhone bottom mic instead of the lavalier mic I was wearing. I spent a lot of time trying to get it all "fixed in post" as they say, but there was only so much I could do. I think I figured out the malfunction though. It shouldn't happen again.

I spent a lot of time trying to get it all "fixed in post" as they say, but there was only so much I could do. I think I figured out the malfunction though. It shouldn't happen again.

text: I'm glad you like it, by the way :grin:
